DOC.HEAD: Crude, Gasoline Futures Fall; Heating Oil Prices Mixed
DOC.TEXT: Energy futures prices were generally lower in thin trading Friday as investors squared their positions in advance of the long holiday weekend. Home heating oil prices, which surged in recent weeks as the temperature plunged, were mixed with the January and February contracts rising in anticipation of increased demand and the later months declining. The January contract rose 1.93 cents to settle at 81.74 cents a gallon on the New York Mercantile Exchange after rising more than 4 cents on Thursday. Crude oil and gasoline futures prices fell across the board. The February contract for West Texas Intermediate, the leading grade of U.S. crude, fell 23 cents to $21.29 per 42-gallon barrel after rising 31 cents in Thursday's session. The January contract for wholesale unleaded gasoline was down 0.18 cent after soaring 2.41 cents on Thursday. William Byers, an oil market analyst with Bear Stearns & Co., said investors were liquidating contracts before the three-day Christmas holiday weekend because of forecasts of warmer weather in the Northeast. Trading was thin and the markets closed early.
